summary: This bill, HR 5161, proposes the establishment of an Office of Young Americans within the Executive Office of the President. The office, headed by a Director, will identify and address issues affecting young Americans (ages 18-40), including employment, education, mental health, housing, and climate change. The Director will advise the President, coordinate federal activities, and make recommendations regarding youth engagement in government. The bill also outlines reporting requirements, compensation, and staffing details. The office aims to support strategic coordination and communication between the Executive Office of the President and Federal agencies with respect to activities pertaining to issues primarily and substantially affecting young Americans.
